etymology.description: Depicts a house with a roof, similar to 宀(宀) (mián, "roof") -> a building with three walls -> shelter
etymology.interpretation: As a pictogram, 广(廣) (guǎng, "shelter") visually represents a three-walled structure under a roof, conveying the concept of shelter or covering. It is closely related to the character 宀(宀) (mián, "roof"), which includes four walls, indicating the structural nuance captured by ancient scribes.
etymology.simplification: 广(廣) was simplified by using the pictographic element alone, omitting the phonetic component 黃(黃).

examples.chinese: 暴风骤雨时(暴風驟雨時)，山洞广可供人躲避(山洞廣可供人躲避)。
examples.pinyin: Bào fēng zhòu yǔ shí, shān dòng guǎng kě gòng rén duǒ bì.
examples.english: When the storm rages, the cave provides shelter.

examples.chinese: 旅途中疲惫时(旅途中疲憊時)，老树下广给予行人庇护(老樹下廣給予行人庇護)。
examples.pinyin: Lǚ tú zhōng pí bèi shí, lǎo shù xià guǎng jǐ yǔ xíng rén bì hù.
examples.english: During a tiring journey, the shelter under the old tree gives travelers protection.
